content.description: Good warmup on a beautiful arete of orange and white granite.
content.location: The obvious arete w/ a stoic tree at the base of it.

climbs.name: The Rock on Her Left Hand Pays the Bills

content.description: Begin up a vegetated crack to a ledge, step left to a hand crack which quickly narrows to fingers. Follow the discontinuous finger crack until a large knob on the left allows you to step left around the Arete to the Stoic Tree Arete anchor.
content.location: Starts right of Stoic Tree Arete

content.description:
Start out by climbing a short pillar near the wall, then stem out and get on the route.  It follows nice orange patina to a groove, then enters a shallow right facing corner to the top.

This was still a bit grainy, but will clean up nicely with a few more ascents.  The name is in reference to flowers which turn and grow into the light. A fitting name, since this climb gets a relatively high amount of sun compared to the rest of the crag.  A good route to climb when it gets cold.
content.location: Farthest left route on the wall.  Starts from a ledge running along the base.

content.description: This route is not listed in the 3rd Edition.  It starts just left of Stoic Tree Arete and climbs up the nice orange face to the left of the arete.  Toward the top, it squeezes that climb and shares the anchor.  This climb was originally done without any bolts.  It was then retrobolted without permission by an anonymous party the next year.
content.protection: Bolts, many of which can be skipped.
